snippet: A deal negotiated with the N.B.A. and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct A.B.A. team.
abstract: Deal negotiated with the NBA and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct ABA team; Silnas are to receive a $500 million upfront payment which would end perpetual payments and settle lawsuit filed by brothers.
lead_paragraph: A deal negotiated with the N.B.A. and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct A.B.A. team.

headline.main: Payout May Come for an A.B.A. Team That Is Long Gone
headline.print_headline: Payout May Come for an A.B.A. Team That Is Long Gone
